intro: Pholidocarpus majadum, commonly known as the Indian white oak, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green on the upper surface and lighter on the underside. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, oval fruits that contain a single seed. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and reforestation projects.
